intro: Turpinia montana var. nepalensis, commonly known as the Nepal turpentine tree, is a shrub or small tree native to the Himalayan regions of Nepal and northern India. It is characterized by its aromatic, resinous leaves and small, yellowish-green flowers that bloom in the spring. The plant produces small, round fruits that are typically red or orange when mature. It thrives in temperate climates and is often found in mountainous areas with well-drained soil. Due to its unique fragrance and ecological role, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
